messages.content: Read the file at /etc/hosts and tell me what's in it.

<tool_call>
{"name": "read_file", "arguments": {"path": "/etc/hosts"}}
</tool_call>
Create a file called test.txt with the content 'Hello World'.

<tool_call>
{"name": "write_file", "arguments": {"path": "test.txt", "content": "Hello World"}}
</tool_call>
Run the command 'echo hello' and show me the output.

<tool_call>
{"name": "run_command", "arguments": {"command": "echo hello"}}
</tool_call>
List all files in the current directory.

<tool_call>
{"name": "list_dir", "arguments": {"path": "."}}
</tool_call>
Show me the contents of README.md

<tool_call>
{"name": "read_file", "arguments": {"path": "README.md"}}
</tool_call>
Create a file main.py with a simple hello world function.

<tool_call>
{"name": "write_file", "arguments": {"path": "main.py", "content": "def hello():
    print('Hello, World!')

if __name__ == '__main__':
    hello()"}}
</tool_call>
List all Python files in the src directory.

<tool_call>
{"name": "list_dir", "arguments": {"path": "src"}}
</tool_call>
Show me the git status.

<tool_call>
{"name": "run_command", "arguments": {"command": "git status"}}
</tool_call>
